values.content:
=You are a professional podcast editor and transcription QA expert.

Clean and enhance the following transcript according to these rules:

- Remove filler words: "um", "uh", "like", "you know", "so yeah" etc.
- Fix grammar, punctuation, and casing.
- Add speaker labels where appropriate.
- Keep meaning intact.
- Provide a 2-sentence summary.
- Provide 3‚Äì4 bullet key takeaways.
- Then provide the full cleaned transcript.
- Your ENTIRE reply must be ONLY valid JSON. No code block. No explanations. No markdown. No backticks.

You are a professional content writer experienced in podcast SEO. Using the provided summary and transcript, produce the following:

1. episode_title ‚Äî catchy, SEO-friendly, one line
2. episode_description ‚Äî 2-3 short paragraphs, SEO optimized, up to 300 words
3. show_notes ‚Äî detailed, 400-800 words, suitable for a blog post
4. episode_tags ‚Äî list of relevant keywords as an array
5. suggested_publish_date ‚Äî ISO 8601 date or "publish now"

Return ONLY valid JSON with exactly these keys. No explanations, no markdown, no code blocks.

=You are an expert podcast content writer. Convert the following show notes into a full-length blog article.

Requirements:
- Format in clean Markdown
- 700‚Äì1000 words
- Use H2 and H3 headings
- Add an author byline at the top (e.g., "Written by the Daily Focus Team")
- Add a short SEO meta description (max 150 characters)
- Expand concepts where useful
- If timestamps exist, integrate them naturally. If none are present, ignore timestamps.
- Keep tone professional, clear, and helpful.

ShowNotes:
{{ $json.show_notes }}

Respond ONLY with valid JSON:

{
  "blog_draft_markdown": "..."
}

=You are an expert social media content repurposer. Convert the following blog article into 4 social post formats.

OUTPUT STRICTLY AS A JSON OBJECT WITH THESE KEYS ONLY:
- linkedin  (long-form post up to 300 words)
- twitter_thread (an array of exactly 5 tweets)
- instagram_caption (short caption + include 5 hashtags)
- tiktok_script (1‚Äì2 line short punchy description)

No backticks. No Markdown. Only return a JSON object and please dont add emojis.

Content to repurpose:
{{ $json.fields.blog_draft_markdown }}

Visual Concept: Modern, minimal layout with bold typography. Add headline text "{{ $json.fields.episode_title }}".
Color palette: high contrast, eye-catching, but clean (no clutter).
Leave space for host/guest photos and podcast logo.
Style: professional YouTube thumbnail, crisp, well-lit, high-quality graphics.
Output must be PNG.

parameters.content:
## Transcription & Transcript Cleanup
The raw audio is transcribed using AI, then cleaned to remove filler words, fix formatting, and produce a structured transcript. The JSON parsing prepares the cleaned transcript for the next steps like episode title generation and notes creation.

## Audio Intake & Preparation
Automatically detects when a new audio file is added to Google Drive and downloads it for processing. This begins the podcast workflow by pulling in the raw audio that will later be transcribed and converted into content.

## Episode Metadata Generation
Uses the cleaned transcript to generate high-quality metadata ‚Äî title, description, show notes, tags, and publish date. Then parses the AI response into clean fields for use in Airtable, Buzzsprout, and social media generation.

## Blog Article Creation
Transforms the show notes into a polished blog post draft in Markdown format. This creates long-form written content that can be published on blogs, websites, or newsletters.

## Store Initial Episode Data in Airtable
Stores the transcript, title, initial notes, tags, and other metadata into Airtable. This creates the first version of the episode record before thumbnails, social posts, and Buzzsprout links are added.

## Social Content Generation
Creates LinkedIn, Twitter thread, Instagram caption, and TikTok script. Merges the content with previous data and updates the Airtable record with all social-ready text.

## Thumbnail Generation
Generates a custom thumbnail for the episode using AI. Saves the image URL into Airtable so it‚Äôs available for marketing and Buzzsprout descriptions.

## Prepare Episode for Buzzsprout
Prepares the final formatted text for publishing, including cleaned description and thumbnail link. Also retrieves the original audio file again to attach to Buzzsprout.

## Publish Episode on Buzzsprout
Uploads the episode with audio, title, and description to Buzzsprout. After Buzzsprout returns the episode URL and ID, these details are stored back in Airtable to keep the episode record complete.

## Notify Team
Sends a structured message to your marketing team with episode title, publish link, thumbnail, and schedule details so they can begin promotion instantly.

# How It Works
### This workflow automatically converts a raw audio recording into a fully published podcast episode. Once an audio file arrives, the workflow extracts the transcript, generates the episode title, description, show notes, tags, and marketing content using AI. It then creates a record in Airtable to store all episode data, generates a YouTube-style thumbnail image, and uploads the final audio to Buzzsprout. After Buzzsprout returns the episode link and publish details, the workflow stores everything back in Airtable for tracking. Finally, it notifies your team on Slack with a summary and publish link. This makes the entire production process fully automated from audio input to podcast publication.

# Setup Steps
## Prepare Airtable
Create an Episode table with fields for title, description, tags, thumbnail URL, Buzzsprout ID, publish date, and all AI-generated content.

## Connect Accounts in n8n
Add credentials for OpenAI, Airtable, Slack, and Buzzsprout (API token + podcast ID).

## Add Trigger
Start with an audio file upload trigger (Webhook or Google Drive trigger).

## Add Transcript & AI Generation Nodes
Use OpenAI Whisper for transcription and GPT for episode content, show notes, and marketing posts.

## Save to Airtable
Create or update the episode record with all generated data.

## Generate Thumbnail
Use OpenAI Image API and store the image URL in Airtable.

## Upload to Buzzsprout
Send the audio file, title, and description to Buzzsprout via HTTP Request.

## Send Slack Notification
Notify your marketing team with episode details and links.
